data.title: EDM star deadmau5 to perform at Caesars Windsor on Oct. 6
data.meta_description: The man, the music, the mouse head — it's deadmau5, and he wants to make you dance at Caesars Windsor on Oct. 6.
data.text:
The man, the music, the mouse head — it's deadmau5, and he wants to make you dance at Caesars Windsor on Oct. 6.

Article content

The man, the music, the mouse head — it’s deadmau5, and he wants to make you dance at Caesars Windsor on Oct. 6.

The renowned electronic dance music DJ and producer is celebrating the 10th anniversary of his mau5trap label with a world tour that includes a stop here in the Rose City.

The event will begin 8 p.m., 19 and older only.

All tickets will cost $40, whether general admission to the floor or reserved mezzanine seating.

Article content

Tickets go on sale online 10 a.m. Thursday via caesarswindsor.com or www.ticketmaster.ca, or at the casino’s box office (377 Riverside Dr. E.) at 2 p.m. the same day.

Born in the Niagara Falls area, deadmau5 — a.k.a. Joel Zimmerman — released his debut album in 2005. Since then, he’s become one of the most well-known and outspoken figures in electronic dance music in the world, recognized for his iconic “mau5head” logo and its accompanying helmet, as well as such tracks as Raise Your Weapon, Ghosts N Stuff, I Remember, and Sofi Needs a Ladder.

Legend has it that he took the stage name deadmau5 (pronounced “dead mouse”) as a teenager because a mouse somehow got into his computer and died.

More upcoming shows at Caesars Windsor:

July 13 — Comedian Wayne Brady

July 20 — 80s pop-rock icons Huey Lewis and the News

August 5 — Comedy ventriloquist Jeff Dunham

August 10 — Singer Tony Orlando

August 20 — Classic rock legend Ian Anderson of Jethro Tull

August 25 — Rocker Gene Simmons of KISS

Sept 8 — Illusionist duo Penn & Teller

Sept 9 — Pop-opera male vocal group Il Divo

Sept 16 — Veteran country-rock band Alabama

Oct. 21 — Comedian George Lopez
